title: SF_SafetyRequest (FunctionBlock)
text:
FUNCTION_BLOCK SF_SafetyRequest
This function block provides the interface to a generic actuator, e.g. a safety drive or safety valve, to place the actuator in a safe state.

rows:
Requested mode of a generic safe actuator. FALSE: Safe mode
is requested. TRUE: Operation mode is requested.

Confirmation of the generic actuator, if actuator is in the
Safe state. FALSE: Operation mode (non-safe). TRUE: Safe
mode.

Monitoring of the response time between the safety function
request (S_OpMode set to FALSE) and the actuator
acknowledgment (S_Acknowledge switches to TRUE).

rows.Name: Ready
rows.Comment:
Activation of the FB. TRUE indicates that the FB is
activated and the outputs results are valid, FALSE the FB is
not active and the program is not executed.

rows:
Confirmation of the Safe state. FALSE: Non-safe state. TRUE:
Safe state.

Request to place the actuator in a safe state. FALSE: Safe
state is requested. TRUE: Non-safe state.

Output indicating that the FB is active and the primary
safety function is demanded (e.g. related to the safety
functionality).

Output which can be used to signal the operator to press the
reset functionality to continue.
